hours_text:
# Plan Your Visit

Welcome to the Spencer Museum of Art!  
Admission is **free for everyone** , always; **no tickets required**.

## Plan Your Visit jump links

Getting to the Museum

[Accessibility](/visit/plan-your-visit#section-accessibility "Accessibility")

[Gallery maps](/visit/plan-your-visit#section-gallery-maps "Gallery maps")

[Visitor guidelines](/visit/plan-your-visit#section-visitor-guidelines "Visitor guidelines")

[Group visits](/visit/plan-your-visit#section-group-visits "Group visits")

## Gallery hours

##  We are open today from 12PM–5PM. 

**Regular hours**

Monday:  CLOSED 

Tuesday:  10AM–5PM 

Wednesday:  10AM–5PM 

Thursday:  10AM–8PM 

Friday:  10AM–5PM 

Saturday:  12PM–5PM 

Sunday:  12PM–5PM 

## Find us on Google Maps

## Getting to the Museum

### Construction

9th St. is currently closed from Indiana St. to Louisiana St. for work on the [Jayhawk Watershed Improvements Project](https://lawrenceks.gov/mso/jayhawk-watershed/). Please take note of the road closure and follow detour signs to safely arrive at the Spencer Museum.

### Parking

**Free parking** for Museum visitors is available in designated spots on the first level of the Mississippi Street Garage next to the Kansas Union during Museum hours. **Make a note of your license plate number and stop at our Welcome Desk to have your parking validated**. The garage is monitored; failure to validate parking may result in a ticket. 

Please note that **individuals who are affiliated with KU are n...

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

We are committed to accessibility and our efforts are ongoing. To request an accommodation for an upcoming event or visit to the Museum, please contact us.

## Accessibility jump links

Getting to the Museum

At the Museum

Contact us

## Getting to the Museum

### Drop off

There is a drop-off area at [the front entrance of the Museum on Mississippi Street](https://maps.app.goo.gl/V5s1BSx29hEnd7UU7). This is a five-minute load/unload zone and vehicles must be not left unattended. [View all parking options near the Museum](/visit/plan-your-visit#section-getting-to-the-museum).

### Accessible parking

There are two accessible parking spots in front of the Museum for those with ADA placards. Please bring your license plate number to the Welcome Desk for validation. These are filled on a first-come, first-serve basis. If you have driven to the Museum anticipating to park in these spaces and they are full, please call 785-864-0130.

### Public transport

There are three accessible public transport options to the Museum: 

  * Lawrence Transit’s ‘[T Lift](https://lawrencetransit.org/ada-services/)’ – a door-to-door shared ride service available to those who, because of disability, are unable to use fixed routes 
  * KU’s [Jaylift](https://accessibility.ku.edu/jaylift) – available to KU students with disabilities 
  * Public bus (accessible for some disabled users)

### Public bus

If you’re not sure which bus route to take you can visit the [Lawrence Transit "Rou...
collections_text:
Pause Play

#  Welcome 

We are a museum at the University of Kansas with two floors of galleries and a collection that represents different types of art from around the world. Admission is free for everyone!

## Iⁿ’zhúje’waxóbe

###  Iⁿ’zhúje’waxóbe 

Return of the Sacred Red Rock 

Open through January 25, this exhibition tells the story of the rematriation of the Sacred Red through artwork created by local artists and Kaw tribal citizens.

[Learn more>](/exhibitions-and-events/exhibitions/current-exhibitions/sacred-red-rock "Learn more>")

## Happening at the museum

[](/about/employment-opportunities "Explore openings >")

### [Now Hiring](/about/employment-opportunities "Explore openings >")

Learn more and apply now for 2026-27 graduate intern positions, as well as Creative Services Student Assistant.

[Explore openings >](/about/employment-opportunities "Explore openings >")

[](/exhibitions-and-events/exhibitions/current-exhibitions/form-flux "Learn more >")

### [Form & Flux](/exhibitions-and-events/exhibitions/current-exhibitions/form-flux "Learn more >")

This new installation in our Lee Study Center features contemporary Asian ceramics that blend centuries-old traditions with innovative artistic expression.

[Learn more >](/exhibitions-and-events/exhibitions/current-exhibitions/form-flux "Learn more >")
